page.title: 12Farming in Sigglesthorne.
page.content: The area around Sigglesthorne is now mainly used for the{intensive production of{cereals.}Most farms have been joined to produce units of approxiamately 300 acres. There is a mixture of tenants and owners. The main land owners in the area are the Strickland-Constables, the Bethell Family and the Crown. Most farms have eliminated livestock from the farm unless it is for specialised production of{pigs, when the disposal of slurry poses a particular environmental problem. Arable production concentrates on the intensive production of{cereal}and {cash crops}such as{oilseed rape, {winter}and{spring wheat}and{barley. {Grass}and{hay}are grown for{silage. Most farms are highly mechanised, using very little{labour}and a wide range of expensive{machinery.
